newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil judge studies B Band cellphone injunction.
newsitem.headline: Brazil judge studies B Band cellphone injunction.

text.p: A Brazilian judge is studying a request for an injunction that would suspend the government's B Band cellular telephone concession plans and may deliver a ruling later on Friday, a court official said.
A trade union has asked the judge to rule on what it considers a breach of constitutional rules included in the B Band privatization.
"The judge is analysing the evidence so he can come to a decision. It could be today, or Monday," the official said.
The case is separate to a challenge to the concessions program in Brazil's Supreme Federal Tribunal which has been lodged by left-wing opposition parties.
The tribunal decided Thursday to put that case on hold for ten days to request further information on the B Band tenders.
